Content: *p71881a02636*26	  		(ii)	 the lead sphere has a radius of 1.2 mm. as it falls it cools from 615 k to 370 k.  the molten lead solidifies at 601 k.			 calculate the mean rate at which energy is transferred from the lead sphere to the surroundings. you should assume that the specific heat capacities of liquid lead and solid lead are the same.			 density of lead = 1.13 × 104 kg m–3			 specific latent heat of lead = 2.47 × 104 j kg–1			 specific heat capacity of lead = 130 j kg–1 k–1(6)mean rate of energy transfer from lead = 	(b)	a teacher demonstrates a mechanical method to determine the specific heat capacity of lead. some lead shot at room temperature is placed in a perspex tube.rubber bungperspex tubelead shotrubber bungdigital thermometer
